segment.source: BitLocker How to deploy on Windows Server 2012 and later (Windows 10)
segment.target: BitLocker How to deploy on Windows Server 2012 and later (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional explains how to deploy BitLocker and Windows Server 2012 and later.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional explains how to deploy BitLocker and Windows Server 2012 and later.

segment.source: BitLocker: How to deploy on Windows Server 2012 and later
segment.target: BitLocker: How to deploy on Windows Server 2012 and later

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional explains how to deploy BitLocker and Windows Server 2012 and later.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional explains how to deploy BitLocker and Windows Server 2012 and later.

segment.source: For all Windows Server editions, BitLocker must be installed using Server Manager.
segment.target: For all Windows Server editions, BitLocker must be installed using Server Manager.

segment.source: However, you can still provision BitLocker before the server operating system is installed as part of your deployment.
segment.target: However, you can still provision BitLocker before the server operating system is installed as part of your deployment.

segment.source: Installing BitLocker
segment.target: Installing BitLocker

segment.source: BitLocker requires administrator privileges on the server to install.
segment.target: BitLocker requires administrator privileges on the server to install.

segment.source: You can install BitLocker either by using Server Manager or Windows PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: You can install BitLocker either by using Server Manager or Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: To install BitLocker using Server Manager
segment.target: To install BitLocker using Server Manager

segment.source: To install BitLocker using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: To install BitLocker using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: To install BitLocker using Server Manager
segment.target: To install BitLocker using Server Manager

segment.source: Open Server Manager by selecting the Server Manager icon or running servermanager.exe.
segment.target: Open Server Manager by selecting the Server Manager icon or running servermanager.exe.

segment.source: Select Manage from the Server Manager Navigation bar and select Add Roles and Features to start the Add Roles and Features Wizard.
segment.target: Select Manage from the Server Manager Navigation bar and select Add Roles and Features to start the Add Roles and Features Wizard.

segment.source: With the Add Roles and Features Wizard open, select Next at the Before you begin pane (if shown).
segment.target: With the Add Roles and Features Wizard open, select Next at the Before you begin pane (if shown).

segment.source: Select Role-based or feature-based installation on the Installation type pane of the Add Roles and Features Wizard pane and select Next to continue.
segment.target: Select Role-based or feature-based installation on the Installation type pane of the Add Roles and Features Wizard pane and select Next to continue.

segment.source: Select the Select a server from the server pool option in the Server Selection pane and confirm the server for the BitLocker feature install.
segment.target: Select the Select a server from the server pool option in the Server Selection pane and confirm the server for the BitLocker feature install.

segment.source: Server roles and features install using the same wizard in Server Manager.
segment.target: Server roles and features install using the same wizard in Server Manager.

segment.source: Select Next on the Server Roles pane of the Add Roles and Features wizard to proceed to the Features pane.
segment.target: Select Next on the Server Roles pane of the Add Roles and Features wizard to proceed to the Features pane.

segment.source: Select the check box next to BitLocker Drive Encryption within the Features pane of the Add Roles and Features Wizard.
segment.target: Select the check box next to BitLocker Drive Encryption within the Features pane of the Add Roles and Features Wizard.

segment.source: The wizard will show the additional management features available for BitLocker.
segment.target: The wizard will show the additional management features available for BitLocker.

segment.source: If you do not want to install these features, deselect the Include management tools option and select Add Features.
segment.target: If you do not want to install these features, deselect the Include management tools option and select Add Features.

segment.source: Once optional features selection is complete, select Next to proceed in the wizard.
segment.target: Once optional features selection is complete, select Next to proceed in the wizard.

segment.source: Note: The Enhanced Storage feature is a required feature for enabling BitLocker.
segment.target: Note: The Enhanced Storage feature is a required feature for enabling BitLocker.

segment.source: This feature enables support for Encrypted Hard Drives on capable systems.
segment.target: This feature enables support for Encrypted Hard Drives on capable systems.

segment.source: Select Install on the Confirmation pane of the Add Roles and Features Wizard to begin BitLocker feature installation.
segment.target: Select Install on the Confirmation pane of the Add Roles and Features Wizard to begin BitLocker feature installation.

segment.source: The BitLocker feature requires a restart to complete.
segment.target: The BitLocker feature requires a restart to complete.

segment.source: Selecting the Restart the destination server automatically if required option in the Confirmation pane will force a restart of the computer after installation is complete.
segment.target: Selecting the Restart the destination server automatically if required option in the Confirmation pane will force a restart of the computer after installation is complete.

segment.source: If the Restart the destination server automatically if required check box is not selected, the Results pane of the Add Roles and Features Wizard will display the success or failure of the BitLocker feature installation.
segment.target: If the Restart the destination server automatically if required check box is not selected, the Results pane of the Add Roles and Features Wizard will display the success or failure of the BitLocker feature installation.

segment.source: If required, a notification of additional action necessary to complete the feature installation, such as the restart of the computer, will be displayed in the results text.
segment.target: If required, a notification of additional action necessary to complete the feature installation, such as the restart of the computer, will be displayed in the results text.

segment.source: To install BitLocker using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: To install BitLocker using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Windows PowerShell offers administrators another option for BitLocker feature installation.
segment.target: Windows PowerShell offers administrators another option for BitLocker feature installation.

segment.source: Windows PowerShell installs features using the or module; however, the and modules do not always share feature name parity.
segment.target: Windows PowerShell installs features using the or module; however, the and modules do not always share feature name parity.

segment.source: Because of this, it is advisable to confirm the feature or role name prior to installation.
segment.target: Because of this, it is advisable to confirm the feature or role name prior to installation.

segment.source: Note: You must restart the server to complete the installation of BitLocker.
segment.target: Note: You must restart the server to complete the installation of BitLocker.

segment.source: Using the servermanager module to install BitLocker
segment.target: Using the servermanager module to install BitLocker

segment.source: The Windows PowerShell module can use either the or to install the BitLocker feature.
segment.target: The Windows PowerShell module can use either the or to install the BitLocker feature.

segment.source: The feature name for BitLocker in the module is .
segment.target: The feature name for BitLocker in the module is .

segment.source: This can be determined using the cmdlet with a query such as:
segment.target: This can be determined using the cmdlet with a query such as:

segment.source: The results of this command displays a table of all of the feature names beginning with “Bit” as their prefix.
segment.target: The results of this command displays a table of all of the feature names beginning with “Bit” as their prefix.

segment.source: This allows you to confirm that the feature name is for the BitLocker feature.
segment.target: This allows you to confirm that the feature name is for the BitLocker feature.

segment.source: By default, installation of features in Windows PowerShell does not include optional sub-features or management tools as part of the install process.
segment.target: By default, installation of features in Windows PowerShell does not include optional sub-features or management tools as part of the install process.

segment.source: This can be seen using the option in Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: This can be seen using the option in Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: The results of this command show that only the BitLocker Drive Encryption feature installs using this command.
segment.target: The results of this command show that only the BitLocker Drive Encryption feature installs using this command.

segment.target: To see what would be installed with the BitLocker feature including all available management tools and sub-features, use the following command:

segment.target: The result of this command displays the following list of all the administration tools for BitLocker that would be installed along with the feature, including tools for use with Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) and Active Directory Lightweight Directory Services (AD LDS).

segment.target: The command to complete a full installation of the BitLocker feature with all available features and then rebooting the server at completion is:

segment.source: Important: Installing the BitLocker feature using Windows PowerShell does not install the Enhanced Storage feature.
segment.target: Important: Installing the BitLocker feature using Windows PowerShell does not install the Enhanced Storage feature.

segment.source: Administrators wishing to support Encrypted Hard Drives in their environment will need to install the Enhanced Storage feature separately.
segment.target: Administrators wishing to support Encrypted Hard Drives in their environment will need to install the Enhanced Storage feature separately.

segment.source: Using the dism module to install BitLocker
segment.target: Using the dism module to install BitLocker

segment.source: The Windows PowerShell module uses the cmdlet to install features.
segment.target: The Windows PowerShell module uses the cmdlet to install features.

segment.source: The BitLocker feature name for BitLocker is .
segment.target: The BitLocker feature name for BitLocker is .

segment.source: The module does not support wildcards when searching for feature names.
segment.target: The module does not support wildcards when searching for feature names.

segment.source: To list feature names for the module, use the cmdlet.
segment.target: To list feature names for the module, use the cmdlet.

segment.source: The following command will list all of the optional features in an online (running) operating system.
segment.target: The following command will list all of the optional features in an online (running) operating system.

segment.source: From this output, we can see that there are three BitLocker related optional feature names: BitLocker, BitLocker-Utilities and BitLocker-NetworkUnlock.
segment.target: From this output, we can see that there are three BitLocker related optional feature names: BitLocker, BitLocker-Utilities and BitLocker-NetworkUnlock.

segment.source: To install the BitLocker feature, the BitLocker and BitLocker-Utilities features are the only required items.
segment.target: To install the BitLocker feature, the BitLocker and BitLocker-Utilities features are the only required items.
